  • Method
org.perfidix.element

Class BenchmarkMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.perfidix.element.BenchmarkMethod

  • public final class BenchmarkMethod
extends Object
    Class to mark one method which are possible benchmarkable. The method hold helping methods and additional functionality for benchmarkable methods like returning possible BeforeBenchClass, BeforeFirstRun, BeforeEachRun, AfterEachRun, AfterLastRun and AfterBenchClass annotated related methods.
    Author:
    Sebastian Graf, University of Konstanz
    See Also:
    AfterBenchClass, AfterLastRun, AfterEachRun, BeforeEachRun, BeforeFirstRun, BeforeBenchClass

      Constructor, with a definite method to bench.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BenchmarkMethod

        public BenchmarkMethod(Method paramMethod)
        Constructor, with a definite method to bench. The method has to be checked with isBenchmarkable(Method) first, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException could arise.
        Parameters:
        paramMethod - method to be benched (eventually)

    • Method Detail

      • findBeforeFirstRun

        public Method[] findBeforeFirstRun()
                            throws PerfidixMethodCheckException
        Method to find a BeforeFirstRun annotation. This method should be invoked for all methods. The corresponding class is searched after suitable methods and checks for integrity are made. If there are multiple BeforeFirstRun -annotated methods available, an exception is thrown. If there are designated special BeforeFirstRun methods as given in the parameter of the Bench-annotation, this method is taken with any further checking of the other methods in the class.
        Returns:
        Annotated method with BeforeFirstRun annotation, null of none exists
        Throws:
        PerfidixMethodCheckException - if integrity check of class and method fails.
        See Also:
        BeforeFirstRun, Bench

      • findBeforeEachRun

        public Method[] findBeforeEachRun()
                           throws PerfidixMethodCheckException
        Method to find a BeforeEachRun annotation. This method should be invoked for all methods. The corresponding class is searched after suitable methods and checks for integrity are made. If there are multiple BeforeEachRun -annotated methods available, an exception is thrown. If there are designated special BeforeEachRun methods as given in the parameter of the Bench-annotation, this method is taken with any further checking of the other methods in the class.
        Returns:
        Annotated method with BeforeEachRun annotation, null of none exists
        Throws:
        PerfidixMethodCheckException - if integrity check of class and method fails.
        See Also:
        BeforeEachRun, Bench

If there are multiple AfterEachRun -annotated methods available, an exception is thrown. If there are designated special AfterEachRun methods as given in the parameter of the Bench-annotation, this method is taken with any further checking of the other methods in the class.

        See Also:
        AfterEachRun, Bench

      • getMethodToBench

        public Method getMethodToBench()
        Simple getter for encapsulated method.
        Returns:
        the methodToBench

      • getNumberOfAnnotatedRuns

        public static int getNumberOfAnnotatedRuns(Method meth)
        Getting the number of runs corresponding to a given method. The method MUST be a benchmarkable method, otherwise an IllegalStateException exception arises. The number of runs of an annotated method is more powerful than the number of runs as denoted by the benchclass annotation.
        Parameters:
        meth - to be checked
        Returns:
        the number of runs of this benchmarkable-method

      • findAndCheckAnyMethodByAnnotation

        public static Method findAndCheckAnyMethodByAnnotation(Class<?> clazz,
                                       Class<? extends Annotation> anno)
                                                throws PerfidixMethodCheckException
        This class finds any method with a given annotation. The method is allowed to occure only once in the class and should match the requirements for Perfidix for an execution by reflection.
        Parameters:
        anno - of the method to be found
        clazz - class to be searched
        Returns:
        a method annotated by the annotation given. The method occurs only once in the class and matched the requirements of perfidix-reflective-invocation.
        Throws:
        PerfidixMethodCheckException - if these integrity checks fail

      • isBenchmarkable

        public static boolean isBenchmarkable(Method meth)
        This method should act as a check to guarantee that only specific Benchmarkables are used for benching.
        Parameters:
        meth - method to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if an instance of this interface is benchmarkable, false otherwise.

      • isReflectedExecutable

        public static boolean isReflectedExecutable(Method meth,
                            Class<? extends Annotation> anno)
        Checks if this method is executable via reflection for perfidix purposes. That means that the method has no parameters, no return-value, is non-static, is public and throws no exceptions.
        Parameters:
        meth - method to be checked
        anno - anno for method to be check, necessary since different attributes are possible depending on the anno
        Returns:
        true if method matches requirements.

        public String getMethodWithClassName()
